reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night as a party of 8 in 4 rooms in July 2007. The hotel is very centrally located, close to the Duomo, La Scala, and about a 25 minute walk to The Last Supper. The rooms are small, but this is typical for most European hotels. They are clean and modern, with nice bathrooms. The front desk are very friendly, and the guest books contain various reviews from celebrities. There is a small but nice breakfast buffet in the breakfast room around the corner from the lobby. We received a great restaurant recommendation from the front desk staff...Hostaria Borromei at 4-20123 Via Borromei. Phone 02.86453760. We arrived and the evening started with complimentary glasses of sparkling wine. It appears to be a family run restaurant that mostly caters to locals, and as a result, it has a great atmosphere with superb food. I had Caprese salad all through our Italian trip and this restaurant served the best I have ever had. The bocconcini cheese simply melts in your mouth. You must go here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is nothing but perfect. It was a two minute walk to the cathedral - excellent if you have limited time to explore the city which we did. The only transport we used was the tram (once) and even this stopped virtually outside the door of the hotel. The rooms are very nice and very modern - some of the art was not to our taste but it was a very stylish hotel nevertheless. The breakfast room was small, but a good selection of cheese/fruit etc and hot food including eggs and omelettes on demand.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Both our rooms were at the back of the hotel and had charming balconies, so no problems with the noise experienced by some of the guests in rooms overlooking the street. Hotel staff were efficient and friendly at all times. The only problem we had was hiring a car in the city centre and trying to find our way back to the hotel - took us half an hour to travel virtually two blocks!! If you dont mind spending a bit more than normal for a great location I can't recommend this place enough.

reviews.text: We took a chance and traveled to Milan from San Gimignano without booking a place to stay in advance for our last night in Italy. I had read the reviews about this hotel on tripadvisor and they were mostly good, but we had a bad experience with a bed and breakfast a few months ago that members had given high marks on tripadvisor. Thus, I was reluctant to book the hotel based on tripadvisor reviews alone. I wanted to see the place before we booked it; I felt sure we'd get a room because I had heard that in August many Italians leave Italy to spend their holidays in Switzerland.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived and were impressed with the hotel as soon as we saw it. We were pleased to learn that a room was available on the 7th floor. It was a beautiful room, and the price was around $250, which was a great bargain. It was wonderfully clean, impeccably furnished and decorated and the location was perfect. We had stayed in a farmhouse in Tuscany at the beginning of our trip, so the modern decor of the Hotel Spadari was a nice change. The staff was very helpful, and the breakfast was really good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Spadari after a two week trip through Italy. It was the fifth and best hotel during our stay in Italy. At slightly more than 225 euros, we enjoyed a very clean, well appointed room just a few blocks from the Duomo. What was amazing about the room was though we were on the first floor and faced the front of the hotel on Via Spadari, we heard no street noise because of the double glass windows. I've heard more street noise staying on the 45th floor in mid-town Manhatten. The Spadari's excellent location close to the cathedral and the galleria afforded us the opportunity to go back and forth to our hotel during the day. This was not a luxury we enjoyed in Rome where more reasonably priced hotels are miles from the main tourist attractions. The bed at the Hotel Spadari was comparable to a bed you would find at a Four Seasons or Fairmont Hotel in The States. We really enjoyed it. We also liked the contemporary decor of the room and hotel. The bathroom was very large, well lit, very clean, and the shower had six heads. The next morning, the hotel being just a couple of blocks from the Duomo subway station, we took the subway to the Cadorna station and caught the Malpensa Express train to the airport. Took 45 minutes and you just walk into Terminal 1. No worries about traffic delays. It was perfect! I loved Hotel Spadari and highly recommend it. Close to lots of cool shops, restaurants, and right next door to Peck's. Outstanding location and value for a hotel! The front desk was also extremely cordial and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Just Blocks from the Duomo and Shops

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved this hotel! Located super close to the Duomo and the shopping areas. The room was modern, very clean and they have flat screen TVs. Staff service is excellent. Free wifi and they even printed our etickets for free. Breakfast was great as well, you get to choose how your eggs are cooked as opposed to the other Italian hotels we've been in where there are either no eggs or scrambled eggs in a buffet tray. Would definitely stay here again - superb value for money!

Fine Hotel, great Location and Staff
reviews.text: Walked in off the street, armed with some internet prices. Spotless room, exquisite (my wife changed "clean" to "exquisite"!) cotton linens, modern fixtures, perfect bathroom. Around 1 corner from the Duomo, and a walk to La Scala. Local parking with valet for 22 Euros. Would stay again and again! 200 Euros per night including breakfast (room service free!) A small balcony with breakfast table off our room (#61) was delightful, surrounded by plants and the cityscape!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nites in a lovely loft suite. Room had been recently renovated and was spacious and clean, the bathroom was huge. Considering other hotel prices in Milan, the roomrate was not bad for such a well located hotel. Service was good except watch out for receptionist called Karen. She failed to make dinner reservations which she promised and we turned up at the restaurant only to find that it wasn't even open!

likes.disliked: — Inconsistent service from front desk staff

reviews.title: Beautiful rooms, great breakfast
reviews.text: We booked at the last minute in shoulder season (mid-Oct) so we didn't know what to expect. Fortunately, we arrived to extremely friendly hotel staff, clean & contemporary hotel. Room was beautiful, very clean, much of the linens and furnishings seemed like they had never been used. Included breakfast in the morning with cappucino to order was just a bit more than a continental but was excellent. There was always someone available who spoke good english. Location could not be much better; very close to the Duomo cathedral and shopping areas.

reviews.title: Helpful beyond the call of duty
reviews.text: Although the room was small it was beautifully appointed with a small balcony from which we could see the spires of the Duomo. We had breakfast each morning on the balcony despite it being October. We had a problem in a restaurant because when we came to pay it did not accept any cards except Amex. The restaurant called the hotel and the receptionist agreed to collect the cash from us the next day and pass it on to the restaurant - how good is that! I cannot recommend this hotel more highly. ps it was the Boeucc Restaurant - don't go there, it's terrible.

reviews.title: Good mid-range hotel
reviews.text: The previous reviewers are right- this hotel is well-situated in Milan and is nicely decorated. The front desk was helpful in locating non-touristy restaurants and selling us stamps and underground tickets. My only hesitancy is in the price. I guess it's the exchange rate but it seemed expensive for a mid-level hotel (think average Hyatt in the US). But I suppose it's a better value than some of the other hotels we were looking at (e.g. Four Seasons).

reviews.title: wonderful experioence
reviews.text: Milan is an interesting city. We had a great lunch at Bice which is very close to the Montenapoleone shopping district. Lovely (but expensive) lunch where we were the only tourists in the restaurant. Really gave us a nice flavor of Italy at the beginning of our trip.

reviews.title: The place to stay in Milan
reviews.text: A beautiful small hotel in a terrific location. The staff was warm and friendly and oh, so helpful. The lobby was filled with lovely art objects with a bright and charming breakfast room and bar. My room had a small balcony from which I could see the top spire of the Duomo. Since it was fashion week , the hotel was fully booked. They could only accomodate me for one night. (I needed two.) They made arrangements for me to move the second night to their sister hotel the Gran Duca di York around the corner. It was seamless. They moved my luggage and all I had to do was check in. For foodies, it right next door to Peck's which a delightful store filled with cheeses, sausages, wines, breads, oils, meats pastas and a deli to die for. I only wish I could have stayed longer.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location!!!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Spadari for two nights on the 9th and 10th of March. We initially booked a standard room but planned to upgrade once we got there. On arrival we found the standard room was great so didn't bother with the uprade. The only down side was our room was on the back of the hotel and the views were not very good, but other than that we thought it was superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: We were greeted with the Best at the Spadari: a room on floor 7 (I believe, 74? it faces Duomo)... A class act all the way. Our room and bed were FANTASTIC-- beautifully modern and well done. Quiet. The best bathroom I saw during our long trip (Holland and Italy)--was at Spadari. The bath had two separate sinks (the secret to a happy marriage) and also a shower separate from the tub, and everything is gorgeous and well done. Towels, robes and slippers (yes!) and perfect lighting; great closets and shelving for the many treasures you will purchase in Milan. You also cannot ask for a better location, walking distance from the Duomo and the shopping meccas, as well as easily accessible via taxi and to and from the trains. The service was outstanding. I can't say anything negative about this hotel, and its wonderful people. Book immediately!!! We will be back.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, great location, great staf & very nice rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second visit to Spadari, the first coming in 2001. I love this place--it is a beautiful little hotel, in a superb location, with friendly staff and a great breakfast. It was booked when I was in Milan in 2004, or this would have been my third stay here. Unless you crave a large hotel, I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone going to Milan.
